My Strompris API¶

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it.

Assignment 5

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: date = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetch one day of data for one location from hvakosterstrommen.no API

Fetches electricity price data for a specific date and location from hvakosterstrommen.no API.

Parameters:

  • date (Datetime.date (optional)) – The date for which to fetch data. If None, defaults to today’s date.

  • location (str (optional)) – The location code for which to fetch data. Defaults to “NO1”.

Returns:

Dataframe containing the fetched data about the prices for the given location and date.

Return type:

pd.Dataframe

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: date = None, days: int = 7, locations: list[str] = ('NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5')) → DataFrame¶

Fetch prices for multiple days and locations into a single DataFrame

Fetches electricity price data for multiple days and locations from hvakosterstrommen.no API.

Parameters:

  • end_date (datetime.date (optional)) – The end date until which to fetch prices. Defaults to today’s date.

  • days (int (optional)) – The number of days to fetch prices for, leading up to the end_date. Defaults to 7.

  • locations (list[str] (optional)) – The list of locations for which to fetch prices. Defaults to all locations.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing prices for multiple days and locations.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

strompris.main()¶

Allow running this module as a script for testing.

strompris.plot_activity_prices(df: DataFrame, activity: str = 'shower', minutes: float = 10) → Chart¶

Plot price for one activity by name, given a data frame of prices, and its duration in minutes.

Make sure to document arguments and return value…

strompris.plot_daily_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot the daily average price

x-axis should be time_start (day resolution) y-axis should be price in NOK

You may use any mark.

Make sure to document arguments and return value…

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot energy prices over time

Creates a line chart showing energy prices over time for different locations.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing data to plot.

Returns:

A chart visualizing energy prices over time for different locations.

Return type:

alt.Chart
